description: Number of compositions of n such that two adjacent parts are not equal modulo 2.
comments: Also (0,1)-strings such that all maximal blocks of 1's have even length and all maximal blocks of 0's have odd length.
references: I. P. Goulden and D. M. Jackson, Combinatorial Enumeration, Wiley, N.Y., 1983,(Problems 2.4.3, 2.4.13).
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0, 2, 1, -1).
formula: a(n) = Sum_{j=0..n+1} binomial(n-j+1, 3*j-n+1).a(n) = 2*a(n-2) + a(n-3) - a(n-4).G.f.: -(x^2-x-1)/(x^4-x^3-2*x^2+1). More generally, g.f. for the number of compositions of n such that two adjacent parts are not equal modulo p is 1/(1-Sum_{i=1..p} x^i/(1+x^i-x^p)).G.f.: W(0)/(2*x^2) -1/x^2, where W(k) = 1 + 1/(1 - x*(k - x)/( x*(k+1 - x) - 1/W(k+1) )); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Aug 28 2013
